actor_awards.notes: One of the few actors to win two Academy Awards for Best Supporting Actor (for 'Hud' and 'Being There'). He transitioned from a suave leading man in 1930s romantic comedies to a highly respected character actor in his later years.

filmography.title: Hud
filmography.role_description: An aging, principled cattle rancher who clashes with his ruthless, amoral son.
filmography.plot: An honest, hard-working Texas rancher comes into conflict with his dissolute son, who is eager to sell the herd when foot-and-mouth disease is suspected.

filmography.title: Being There
filmography.role_description: A dying, wealthy industrialist who befriends a simple-minded gardener, mistaking his platitudes for profound wisdom.
filmography.plot: A simple-minded gardener named Chance becomes an unlikely advisor to a powerful businessman and an insider in Washington politics.

filmography.title: Ninotchka
filmography.role_description: A charming Parisian playboy who melts the icy heart of a stern Soviet envoy.
filmography.plot: A stern Soviet woman sent to Paris to supervise the sale of jewels seized from the Russian nobility falls for a dashing count.

filmography.title: I Never Sang for My Father
filmography.role_description: A domineering, aging father whose declining health forces his son to confront their difficult relationship.
filmography.plot: A man wishing to get married and move away struggles to sever ties with his elderly, difficult father.

filmography.title: The Changeling
filmography.role_description: A powerful senator whose family history is linked to a vengeful spirit haunting a composer.
filmography.plot: A man staying at a secluded historical mansion finds himself being haunted by the presence of a spectre.
filmography.awards: Genie Award: Win – Best Performance by a Foreign Actor

filmography.title: Mr. Blandings Builds His Dream House
filmography.role_description: The cynical lawyer and best friend of the Blandings family who watches their home-building disaster unfold.
filmography.plot: A Manhattan family moves to Connecticut to build their dream home, but construction troubles soon threaten their sanity and bank account.

filmography.title: The Old Dark House
filmography.role_description: A cynical war veteran who finds romance and danger when stranded in a spooky house during a storm.
filmography.plot: Seeking shelter from a storm, five travelers are trapped in a bizarre old house with an eccentric family.

filmography.title: A Woman's Face
filmography.role_description: A plastic surgeon who reconstructs the face of a scarred female criminal, changing her life.
filmography.plot: A female blackmailer with a disfigured face undergoes plastic surgery, giving her a new lease on life but complicating her criminal past.

filmography.title: The Americanization of Emily
filmography.role_description: An unstable Admiral who demands that the first man to die on Omaha Beach must be a sailor.
filmography.plot: During WWII, an American officer who specializes in 'dog-robbing' for his superiors falls in love with a British war widow.

filmography.title: Billy Budd
filmography.role_description: A veteran sailmaker on a British warship who befriends the innocent new recruit.
filmography.plot: In 1797, a naive seaman joins a British man-of-war and becomes a target for the sadistic master-at-arms.

filmography.title: The Tenant
filmography.role_description: The strict and suspicious landlord of the apartment building where the protagonist slowly loses his mind.
filmography.plot: A bureaucrat rents a Paris apartment where he finds himself drawn into a rabbit hole of dangerous paranoia.

filmography.title: The Candidate
filmography.role_description: The former governor of California and father of the senatorial candidate.
filmography.plot: Bill McKay is a candidate for the U.S. Senate from California who has no intention of winning.

filmography.title: Ghost Story
filmography.role_description: One of four elderly men in the Chowder Society who are haunted by a secret from their youth.
filmography.plot: Four friends who share a dark secret from their past are haunted by a vengeful spirit.

filmography.title: Captains Courageous
filmography.role_description: The wealthy, preoccupied father of a spoiled boy who learns life lessons at sea.
filmography.plot: A spoiled brat who falls off a steamship gets picked up by a fishing boat, where he's made to earn his keep.

filmography.title: Theodora Goes Wild
filmography.role_description: The illustrator and sophisticated city man who discovers the secret identity of a small-town author.
filmography.plot: A small-town Sunday school teacher writes a racy novel under a pseudonym, causing a scandal when the truth comes out.

filmography.title: That Uncertain Feeling
filmography.role_description: A successful insurance salesman whose wife develops a psychosomatic hiccup condition and an interest in a pianist.
filmography.plot: A happily married woman sees a psychoanalyst for her hiccups and is advised to look for romance outside her marriage.

filmography.title: Two-Faced Woman
filmography.role_description: A magazine editor who marries a ski instructor, only to be tested when she poses as her own twin sister.
filmography.plot: When a ski instructor's husband seems to be straying, she invents a twin sister to win him back.

filmography.title: She Married Her Boss
filmography.role_description: A department store owner who marries his efficient secretary for convenience, not realizing she loves him.
filmography.plot: A talented secretary marries her boss to help organize his chaotic home life, but struggles to win his love.

filmography.title: Twilight's Last Gleaming
filmography.role_description: The Secretary of Defense dealing with a rogue general who has taken over a nuclear silo.
filmography.plot: An Air Force general escapes from a military prison and takes over an ICBM silo, threatening to start World War III.

filmography.title: Hotel
filmography.role_description: The owner of the St. Gregory Hotel in New Orleans, fighting to keep it independent.
filmography.plot: The owner of a New Orleans hotel struggles to keep it afloat while dealing with various guests and a corporate takeover attempt.

filmography.title: Annie Oakley
filmography.role_description: The dashing manager of Buffalo Bill's Wild West Show who becomes a love interest for Annie.
filmography.plot: A fictionalized biography of the famous sharpshooter Annie Oakley and her romance with fellow shooter Toby Walker.

filmography.title: The Vampire Bat
filmography.role_description: A police inspector investigating a series of murders in a European village plagued by superstition.
filmography.plot: When corpses drained of blood begin to show up in a European village, the townspeople suspect a vampire is on the loose.

filmography.title: As You Desire Me
filmography.role_description: A man who believes a cabaret singer is his long-lost wife, leading to a mystery of identity.
filmography.plot: A Budapest cabaret singer is pursued by a man who claims she is the amnesiac wife of an Italian count.

filmography.title: Too Many Husbands
filmography.role_description: The current husband of a woman whose first husband, presumed dead, suddenly returns.
filmography.plot: A woman who remarried after her first husband was declared dead faces a dilemma when he returns alive.

filmography.title: Counselor at Law
filmography.role_description: A lawyer and rival in this drama starring John Barrymore.
filmography.plot: A successful Jewish lawyer who fought his way up from poverty faces a crisis that threatens to destroy his career.

filmography.title: The Seduction of Joe Tynan
filmography.role_description: An aging, senile Senator who opposes the ambitious younger politician Joe Tynan.
filmography.plot: A liberal Senator struggles with the compromise of his values and his family life as he climbs the political ladder.
filmography.awards: Los Angeles Film Critics Association: Win – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: Tell Me That You Love Me, Junie Moon
filmography.role_description: A wealthy man who takes an interest in the disfigured protagonist.
filmography.plot: Three misfits—a disfigured woman, a paraplegic gay man, and an epileptic—decide to live together to support each other.
